alert.note: Alert for Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 01 at 5:57PM AKST until February 02 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Skagway and the Klondike Highway. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Accumulating snow is expected across Upper Lynn Canal beginning this evening and continuing through late Wednesday night. Heaviest snowfall rates expected late tonight through Wednesday morning. Lighter snowfall rates likely Wednesday afternoon and evening. Additional light snow is expected to continue through the end of the week; however confidence is low regarding a possible transition to rain at sea level.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
